intro: Duguetia oligocarpa, commonly known as the golden star apple, is a small to medium-sized tree native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, white flowers that bloom throughout the year, followed by small, yellowish fruits. The fruit has a sweet, aromatic pulp that is edible and often consumed fresh or used in local cuisines. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruit, it is also cultivated in some tropical regions for both aesthetic and culinary purposes.
